Posts.Content: Oct 11, 2015 10:08PM meezers3 wrote: Littlblue I wish I could find out more information on that too! My nurse gave me saline solution to help keep away infection. I soak gauze pads with the saline, apply for 10-20 minutes and then let the skin air dry for another 20 mins. Then I mix lidocaine gel into aquaphor apply it really thick. I wear a cotton tank top. The only time I use a bandage is to prevent any rubbing. My nurse gave me some bandages with a plastic coating so it doesn't stick and rip off more skin etc. I soak 2-3 times a day. It seems to be a good balance to let it get some air for awhile and then cover it with the aquaphor.

Posts.Content: Oct 15, 2015 07:03PM meezers3 wrote: Goofy foot so sorry to hear you have moist desquamation. I know the pain can be horrible. My RO eventually gave me a prescription for Percocet. I could take 1-2 every six hours. I was taking one and not every six hours. I saw the nurse a week later and the pain was getting worse each day. She told me to definitely take 2. Then the pain was unbearable and I finally started taking 2 every six hours. I don't know how I could have survived with out doing that. I had to keep ahead of the pain or pay the price. I'm 9 days post rads and felt some improvement today!
